1.name: Rebecca
1.description: A self-conscious bride is tormented by the memory of her husband's dead first wife.

2.name: Pinocchio
2.description: A living puppet, with the help of a cricket as his conscience, must prove himself worthy to become a real boy.

3.name: The Great Dictator
3.description: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

4.name: The Grapes of Wrath
4.description: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land. They travel to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

5.name: The Shop Around the Corner
5.description: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

6.name: The Philadelphia Story
6.description: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

7.name: Fantasia
7.description: A collection of animated interpretations of great works of Western classical music.

8.name: Brother Orchid
8.description: When retired racket boss John Sarto tries to reclaim his place and former friends try to kill him, he finds solace in a monastery and reinvents himself as a pious monk.

9.name: The Blue Bird
9.description: Mytyl and her brother Tyltyl, a woodchopper's children, are led by the Fairy Berylune on a magical trip through the past, present, and future to locate the Blue Bird of Happiness.

10.name: His Girl Friday
10.description: A newspaper editor uses every trick in the book to keep his ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying.

11.name: The Thief of Bagdad
11.description: After being tricked and cast out of Bagdad by the evil Jaffar, King Ahmad joins forces with a thief named Abu to reclaim his throne, the city, and the Princess he loves.

12.name: They Drive by Night
12.description: When one of 2 truck driving brothers loses an arm, they both join a transport company where later, the other is falsely charged as an accessory in the murder of the owner.

13.name: The Letter
13.description: The wife of a rubber plantation administrator shoots a man to death and claims it was self-defense, but a letter in her own hand may prove her undoing.

14.name: The Mark of Zorro
14.description: A young aristocrat must masquerade as a fop in order to maintain his secret identity of Zorro as he restores justice to early California.

15.name: Pride and Prejudice
15.description: Mr. and Mrs. Bennet have five unmarried daughters, and Mrs. Bennet is especially eager to find suitable husbands for them. When the rich single gentlemen Mr. Bingley and Mr. Darcy come to ...                See full summary »

16.name: The Westerner
16.description: Judge Roy Bean, a self-appointed hanging judge in Vinegarroon, Texas, befriends saddle tramp Cole Harden, who opposes Bean's policy against homesteaders.

17.name: Foreign Correspondent
17.description: On the eve of World War II, a young American reporter tries to expose enemy agents in London.

18.name: Waterloo Bridge
18.description: During World War I, believing her fiance to be dead, a young ballerina loses her job and is forced to turn to prostitution. From there, things only get worse for her in this tragic, heart-wrenching, love story.

19.name: Santa Fe Trail
19.description: In 1854, Jeb Stuart, George Custer and other graduates from West Point are posted to Kansas to help pacify the territory before railroad construction to Santa Fe can resume.

20.name: One Million B.C.
20.description: Tale of Prehistoric survival and love between a male and a female belonging to opposing tribes that happened to be at slightly different stages of evolution.

21.name: My Favorite Wife
21.description: Missing for seven years and presumed dead, a woman returns home on the day of her husband's second marriage.

22.name: The Return of Frank James
22.description: Frank James continues to avoid arrest in order to take revenge on the Ford brothers for their murder of his brother Jesse.

23.name: Gaslight
23.description: Twenty years after the murder of Alice Barlow, her house is finally occupied again. However, the husband of the couple who have moved in has a secret which he will do anything to keep hidden.

24.name: Virginia City
24.description: Union officer Kerry Bradford escapes from Confederate Prison and is set to Virginia City in Nevada. Once there he finds that the former commander of his prison Vance Irby is planning to send $5 million in gold to save the Confederacy.

25.name: Night Train to Munich
25.description: When Germany invades Czechoslovakia, the German and the British intelligence services try to capture Czech scientist Axel Bomasch, inventor of a new type of armor-plating.

26.name: Saps at Sea
26.description: Oliver suffers a nervous breakdown as a result of working in a horn factory, but when he follows doctor's orders about sea air, he finds an ex-con is aboard.

27.name: Flash Gordon Conquers the Universe
27.description: Flash Gordon, Dale Arden and Dr. Zarkov return to the planet Mongo for an antidote to the Purple Death, which wreaking destruction on Earth. However, Ming the Merciless has other plans for them.

28.name: The Long Voyage Home
28.description: In 1940, the motley crew of the British tramp steamer SS Glencairn prepares the ship for its perilous voyage from the West Indies to Baltimore and then to England.

29.name: Our Town
29.description: Change comes slowly to a small New Hampshire town in the early 20th century. People grow up, get married, live, and die. Milk and the newspaper get delivered every morning, and nobody locks...                See full summary »

30.name: The Green Hornet
30.description: A newspaper publisher and his Korean servant fight crime as vigilantes who pose as a notorious masked gangster and his aide.

31.name: My Little Chickadee
31.description: Rightly suspected of illicit relations with the Masked Bandit, Flower Belle Lee is run out of Little Bend. On the train she meets con man Cuthbert J. Twillie and pretends to marry him for "...                See full summary »

32.name: The Sea Hawk
32.description: Geoffrey Thorpe, a buccaneer, is hired by Queen Elizabeth I to nag the Spanish Armada. The Armada is waiting for the attack on England and Thorpe surprises them with attacks on their galleons where he shows his skills on the sword.

33.name: Dance, Girl, Dance
33.description: Judy O'Brien is an aspiring ballerina in a dance troupe. Also in the company is Bubbles, a brash mantrap who leaves the struggling troupe for a career in burlesque. When the company ...                See full summary »

34.name: The Mortal Storm
34.description: The Roth family leads a quiet life in a small village in the German Alps during the early 1930s. When the Nazis come to power, the family is divided and Martin Brietner, a family friend is caught up in the turmoil.

35.name: The Bank Dick
35.description: Henpecked Egbert Sousé has comic adventures as a substitute film director and unlikely bank guard.

36.name: 'Northwest Passage' (Book I -- Rogers' Rangers)
36.description: Langdon Towne and Hunk Marriner join Major Rogers' Rangers as they wipe out an Indian village. They set out for Fort Wentworth, but when they arrive they find no soldiers and none of the supplies they expected.

37.name: The Mummy's Hand
37.description: An ancient mummy is revived to destroy the invaders of the 3,000 year-old tomb of an Egyptian princess.

38.name: Remember the Night
38.description: A shoplifter and her prosecutor fall in love, creating tensions for his career and family.

39.name: Road to Singapore
39.description: Two playboys try to forget previous romances in Singapore - until they meet a beautiful dancer.

40.name: The Invisible Woman
40.description: An attractive model with an ulterior motive volunteers as guinea pig for an invisibility machine.

41.name: The Invisible Man Returns
41.description: The owner of a coal mining operation, falsely imprisoned for fratricide, takes a drug to make him invisible, despite its side effect: gradual madness.

42.name: Kitty Foyle
42.description: A hard-working, white-collar girl from a middle-class family meets and falls in love with a young socialite, but she soon clashes with his family.

43.name: Jud Süß
43.description: Infamous anti-Semitic Nazi propaganda historical drama about Duke Karl Alexander of Württemberg and his treasurer Süß Oppenheimer.

44.name: North West Mounted Police
44.description: In 1885, a Texas Ranger travels to Canada to arrest a trapper who's wanted for murder and who's stirring up the Natives in a rebellion against the Canadian government.

45.name: Angels Over Broadway
45.description: A cuckolded embezzler on the verge of suicide is helped by a tout, an alcoholic playwright, and a pick-up girl to reimburse the money with a gambling sting.

46.name: The Ghost Breakers
46.description: A radio broadcaster, his quaking manservant and an heiress investigate the mystery of a haunted castle in Cuba.

47.name: Boom Town
47.description: Two buddies who rise from fly-by-night wildcatters to oil tycoons over a twenty year period both love the same woman.

48.name: All This, and Heaven Too
48.description: A duchess' irrational behavior toward the governess of her children triggers tragic events that will change her family's lives forever.

49.name: Turnabout
49.description: Bickering husband and wife Tim and Sally Willows mutter a few angry words to a statue of Buddha and wind up living each other's life.

50.name: Abe Lincoln in Illinois
50.description: Humble Abraham Lincoln gains the respect of his Illinois neighbors, growing in stature and respect until he is elected President in 1860 and departs for Washington.
